Module JBubbleBobble2
Package BubbleBobble.model

Class Apple

java.lang.Object
BubbleBobble.model.Collidable
BubbleBobble.model.Apple
public class Apple extends Collidable
Represents an Apple object in the game, which can be collected by the hero to gain an extra life. The Apple falls from a certain height and becomes collectible after a short grace period. The Apple class extends Collidable and is added to the list of apples in the level. When the hero collides with the apple, the hero's lives are increased by 1.

  • Constructor Details

    • Apple

      public Apple(Level level, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Creates an Apple instance at the specified position with the given dimensions. The apple starts falling and becomes collectible after a grace period.
      Parameters:
      level - The level in which the apple will exist.
      x - The x-coordinate of the apple's position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the apple's position.
      width - The width of the apple.
      height - The height of the apple.

  • Method Details

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition()
      Updates the position of the apple. In this case, it stops falling once it has reached the ground. The vertical speed is set to 0, and the apple is no longer considered as falling.
      Specified by:
      updatePosition in class Collidable

    • addToList

      public void addToList()
      Adds the apple to the list of apples in the current level. This allows the apple to be tracked and interacted with by the game system.
      Specified by:
      addToList in class Collidable

    • collideWithHero

      public void collideWithHero()
      Checks if the apple has collided with the hero. If the hero can touch the apple, the hero's life is increased by 1. The apple is then removed from the game.
